item.title: Twitch's Co-Op Game of 2025 May Just Be Peak
item.description:
It’s rare for an indie co-op game to explode overnight, Peak has done exactly that. In a matter of days, this game has climbed Twitch’s trending charts with the same tenacity players need to survive its unforgiving slopes. At the time of writing, Peak has amassed over 145,000 viewers on Twitch, surpassing mainstay titles like Grand Theft Auto 5 and sitting just below Just Chatting .

The success mirrors breakout hits like Lethal Company and Phasmophobia , where tight co-op gameplay, comedic chaos, and high-stakes tension merge into a perfect storm of streamable fun. Peak arrives at the right moment, proving once again that games built around emergent gameplay and unpredictable teamwork are among the most magnetic experiences in modern gaming.

The Heart of the Climb in Peak

Developed by Landcrab (a collaboration between publishers Aggro Crab and Landfall), Peak places up to four players in the shoes of lost nature scouts trying to summit a shape-shifting mountain. Every 24 hours, Peak ’s map shuffles, meaning no two climbs are ever the same. Players must work together to scale treacherous cliffs, navigate biomes, and overcome increasingly dangerous terrain with nothing but questionable food and random supplies. Every step forward risks a step back, and a single mistake can spell doom for an entire team.

To survive, players must coordinate actions with precision. Tasks include hauling teammates to safety, placing spikes and ropes, scavenging for resources, and managing injuries. Four distinct biomes, ranging from tropical ruins to icy peaks, add layers of complexity and visual variety to each ascent. As players progress, they also unlock dozens of badges, upgrades, and costumes, ensuring each climb is not only unique but also highly personalized. It’s a formula built for a highly replayable game, and it’s no surprise that players and streamers are already hooked.

Peak is Built for Streamers and Spectators Alike

One of the most compelling aspects of Peak is how well it translates to livestreaming. Its gameplay loop is full of tension and release, co-op game teamwork, and chaos, which is exactly the kind of high-energy environment that keeps viewers locked in. The voice chat feature adds another layer of immersion, allowing players’ panic, joy, and frustration to unfold in real time chaos. As one developer noted, the goal was to make every moment feel unpredictable, and the result is a constant stream of shareable, laugh-out-loud content.

Like other Twitch-friendly streaming games before it, Peak thrives on failure just as much as success. Watching a climber mistime a jump and send their entire party tumbling down the mountain isn’t just entertaining, it’s the core of what makes the game so viral. The gameplay practically demands reaction content, and the randomness of each run means that no two streams look alike.

Games like Phasmophobia , Lethal Company , and even Only Up! found similar success by building experiences that viewers could enjoy as much as players. Peak follows in those footsteps but adds its own twist through cooperative chaos and lighthearted aesthetics. It's visually appealing, mechanically tense, and socially charged, all the elements a game needs to dominate Twitch.

Peak is Climbing in Familiar Footsteps

This isn’t the first time a game with vertical momentum and social mechanics has stormed the scene. Lethal Company exploded in popularity thanks to its mix of horror, co-op teamwork, and unpredictable danger. Players found themselves both scared and entertained as they worked together to survive, sometimes at the expense of one another. Peak delivers a similar formula but trades fear for frenzied fun, making it a standout option for players looking for something less spooky but just as wild.

Phasmophobia and REPO similarly carved out their place in the Twitch zeitgeist, showing how unpredictability, voice interaction, and physics-based mechanics can elevate even the simplest of concepts. Peak doesn't just borrow from those successes—it refines them. Instead of just being about jumping or surviving, it makes teamwork essential. And when a game depends on its players to support one another under pressure, the results are always compelling.

REPO also exploded on Twitch in 2025; Peak has a long ways to go to take the throne, but it has started on the right foot to match REPO 's peak popularity.

Peak's Community is on the Rise

Beyond the streaming numbers, Peak is cultivating a community that thrives on cooperation, creativity, and a sense of chaos. From fan art of costumed climbers to compilation videos on TikTok of hilarious wipeouts, the game is already generating the kind of grassroots buzz that transforms good indie video games into long-term fixtures. Its Twitch popularity is more than a fleeting trend; it’s a sign that players are craving fresh multiplayer experiences that let them connect, laugh, and occasionally scream together. It’s a game that doesn’t demand perfection but rewards resilience and teamwork. The goal might be the summit, but the joy is in the climb, and Peak has captured that feeling perfectly.

item.title: How to Get the LEGO Fortnite Free Discord Avatar Decoration
item.description:
LEGO Fortnite has received yet another mode for fans to dive into, serving as a major departure from the survival gameplay of LEGO Fortnite Odyssey and the RPG-style fun of LEGO Fortnite Brick Life . This mode is none other than LEGO Fortnite Expeditions —a unique four-player co-operative experience where players can take on missions as superheroes.

While players may be busy completing quests in LEGO Fortnite Expeditions , the mode also presents a great opportunity to earn a fun cosmetic reward for their Discord profile. Discord and Fortnite have teamed up once again to celebrate the launch of this exciting mode. Here’s how to get the free LEGO Fortnite Avatar Decoration for Discord.

How to Accept the LEGO Fortnite Quest on Discord

Before users can go ahead and claim their free LEGO Fortnite Discord Avatar Decoration, they’ll first need to accept the LEGO Fortnite Quest. This quest can be found via the Discover Tab , which players can access by clicking the Discovery icon located just below their available servers, or by heading to User Settings and navigating to the Gift Inventory tab.

Here’s a quick breakdown on how to accept the quest:

  1. Head to the Discover Tab and navigate to Quests.
  2. Locate the LEGO Fortnite Quest and click "Accept Quest."
  3. Choose the platform you want to complete the quest on.

Once accepted, players can complete the quest to earn the reward. Discord Quests can be accepted on both desktop and console, but mobile users will not be able to accept the quest at this time.

How to Get the LEGO Fortnite Avatar Decoration on Discord

Upon accepting the LEGO Fortnite Quest, players will need to play LEGO Fortnite Expeditions for a total of 15 minutes with Discord active to unlock a free LEGO Fortnite Avatar Decoration. While the quest does specifically mention LEGO Fortnite Expeditions , players can actually play any Fortnite mode, including Battle Royale or Blitz Royale.

In fact, players can even leave Fortnite running in the background to progress the quest, making it possible to earn the reward without actively playing a mode they may not enjoy. Once players have had Fortnite running for 15 minutes, they can claim the LEGO Fortnite Avatar Decoration.

To do so, simply head back to the LEGO Fortnite Quest and select “Claim Reward.” From there, players can also choose “Use Now” to instantly equip the awarded Avatar Decoration.

The LEGO Fortnite Discord Quest is only available for a limited time, ending on June 23. Users will also only be able to use their LEGO Fortnite Avatar Decoration for free for two months. After that period, they will need to purchase it from the Discord Shop to use it again.

LEGO Fortnite Odyssey

item.title: World of Warcraft Players Team Up With an Unexpected Ally in Patch 11.2 Raid
item.description:
The following contains spoilers for World of Warcraft Patch 11.2.

Manaforge Omega, the raid from World of Warcraft Patch 11.2, culminates in a final battle against Dimensius, the All-Devouring – and surprisingly, players team up with Xal'atath in order to defeat him. Though the Harbinger of the Void has been a major antagonist during The War Within , fans may find themselves fighting on the same side in the next World of Warcraft update.

World of Warcraft recently revealed Patch 11.2, Ghosts of K’aresh. The final major update for The War Within takes players to the shattered homeworld of the Ethereals and Brokers as they seek to prevent the resurrection of Dimensius, the All-Devouring, the Void Lord responsible for destroying K’aresh.

This showdown takes place within Manaforge Omega, the update’s new raid. Described as the largest boss in World of Warcraft history, Dimensius will be a clash of cosmic proportions that requires fans to fight against gravity and gamma rays, contend with rival Void Lords he consumed in the past, and even dodge fragments of worlds devoured by the All-Devouring. However, according to the encounter write-up in the Adventure Guide on the Public Test Realm, Xal’atath will play an integral role in beating him, empowering players to temporarily fly during his intermission phase and even creating an opening with a devastating counterattack near the end of the fight.

Xal’atath Helps Fight Dimensius in WoW Patch 11.2

Xal’atath aiding the heroes comes as a surprise, as she has been a major adversary since her appearance in The War Within . However, the Shadowguard Ethereals who stole the Dark Heart from her in WoW Patch 11.1 are the ones responsible for reviving Dimensius, not her. Likewise, Xal'atath is no friend of the Old Gods, as her new Lorewalking story reiterates. Her exact reasoning for wanting the Void Lord dead is unclear, but it is obvious she really does not want him to come back if she is willing to help the champions who have disrupted several of her schemes in order to stop him once and for all – though it remains to be seen how long this unlikely alliance will survive.

Manaforge Omega Raid Boss List

  • Plexus Sentinel
  • Loom’ithar
  • Soulbinder Naazindhri
  • Forgeweaver Araz
  • The Soul Hunters (optional)
  • Fractillus
  • Nexus-King Salhadaar
  • Dimensius, the All-Devouring

Though perhaps not as large, the other encounters in Manaforge Omega look quite exciting as well. Fans will face Shadowguard constructs, servants of Dimensius, a moth-like creature that provides the silk for Ethereal bandages, an animated chunk of K’aresh, and a council of Demon Hunters who could be teasing a new specialization for the World of Warcraft class. The penultimate fight even brings back Nexus-King Salhadaar, the ruler of the Ethereals from The Burning Crusade who became a servant of Dimensius.

Patch 11.2 doesn’t have a release date yet, but players can likely expect it to arrive sometime in August. Until then, the update is already on the PTR, so interested fans can start learning more about the events leading up to the battle between Dimensius and Xal’atath right now.

item.title: Baldur's Gate 3, Dungeons and Dragons' New UA Class Are Two Ships Passing in the Night
item.description:
When Baldur's Gate 3 took the game industry by storm in 2023, it only seemed logical that it would get robust DLC support to further flesh out its (already robust) story and gameplay to give the flourishing fanbase reason to stick around. Larian Studios did offer a good amount of post-launch support, like Baldur's Gate 3 Patch 8 adding a wealth of new subclasses, but no DLC ever appeared. Larian Studios has confirmed that it's moving on from BG3 , so fans shouldn't expect any other major content drops. That's especially heartbreaking because Dungeons and Dragons just started playtesting a class that would've fit BG3 perfectly: the Psion.

It's not every day that Dungeons and Dragons adds a whole new class, especially the current addition. Over the course of a decade after DnD 5e launched, Wizards of the Coast only added one more class to the starting roster: the Artificer. That may change soon, though, thanks to the new Unearthed Arcana document detailing the Psion class, an Intelligence-based psychic spellcaster with a lot of possible playstyles. Any Baldur's Gate 3 fan knows that psionic creatures and psychic powers are central to the game's story, which means the Psion would've been the perfect class to add post-launch, but it's clear that BG3 and this ideal bonus class just barely missed each other.

Dungeons and Dragons' New Psion Class Arrived Just Too Late to Join Baldur's Gate 3

Dungeons and Dragon's UA Psion Class Explained

The new Psion class is an intersection of a lot of existing DnD 5e concepts. It's an Int-based caster with a d6 hit die, much like a Wizard, and it uses a secondary resource pool of Psionic Energy Dice to activate various class features, just like certain psionic-themed DnD subclasses like the Psi Warrior Fighter and the Soulknife Rogue. It's also similar to a Cleric in that the subclasses cater to widely varying playstyles: the mutating Metamorph encourages the Psion to fight in melee range but also packs notable healing abilities, while the Psi Warper is rich with teleportation and crowd control abilities.

Dungeons and Dragons previously tested a very different version of a Psion with a ton of customization options, but it never made it to print, likely due to being far too overpowered and versatile.

Why the Psion Would've Been Perfect for Baldur's Gate 3

Altogether, there are a ton of reasons the Psion would've been the perfect bonus class for Baldur's Gate 3 . For one, it's just an obvious thematic match. The whole main plot of BG3 is all about mind flayers and mysterious psychic phenomena, so it would be a major flavor win to play as a Psion pitting their psychic prowess against equally potent psionic adversaries.

For another thing, its mechanical design would play very nicely with the design of Baldur's Gate 3 . BG3 's combat makes excellent use of terrain: rooftops, cliff faces, and environmental hazards like lava encourage players to spend their movement carefully and use spells or Strength to shove enemies into disadvantageous positions. The Psion is packed with movement options like telekinesis and teleportation, so it could wreak havoc in BG3 's many encounters.

The Psion also would've filled a simple need in BG3 's class roster. The Wizard class in Baldur's Gate 3 is the player's only option for an Intelligence-based class, meaning Intelligence factors into few other builds, save for certain Int-based subclasses. As a more Bard-style spellcaster with a limited spell list but lots of extra class features, the Psion would've been a great change of pace from the Wizard.

The Psion and BG3 Stand Apart Officially, But Can Meet Unofficially

Admittedly, it was always a long shot that Baldur's Gate 3 would add this class, even if WotC had unveiled the Psion during BG3 's post-launch support period. Balancing a whole class is no easy task, and the Psion may have felt a bit redundant due to BG3 's mind flayer tadpole mechanics. Still, there is a way that the Psion can join BG3 ; Larian Studios has built lots of mod support into the game, so Psion-loving modders can hand-craft a way for this compelling new class to feature in BG3 . In the meantime, though, it's a shame that BG3 and the Psion never got to meet, given how much they have in common.

item.title: Fortnite: All Super Styles in Chapter 6 Season 3
item.description:
On June 18, Fortnite launched its first major update of Chapter 6 Season 3, right before Epic Games employees left to enjoy their summer holidays. With this patch, the final pages of the Bonus Rewards tab became available at last, meaning fans were finally able to take a look at the Fortnite SUPER Super styles.

This guide will tell players what they need to know about the rarest alternative styles for the Chapter 6 Season 3 Battle Pass skins. This way, they can start planning their season ahead and make sure that they're able to earn enough XP to get their favorite skins' bonus styles in Fortnite .

How to Unlock Chapter 6 Season 3 Super Styles in Fortnite

Super Styles consist of three of the eight pages of Bonus Rewards, available only to those who purchase the Battle Pass. After completing the first 100 levels of the Battle Pass, gamers will finally unlock Bonus Rewards tab, and here they can get access to an array of cosmetics and additional styles for their favorite skins.

Page 6, 7, and 8 are exclusively reserved for Super Styles. Before, they must unlock a total of 35 rewards, and each one is only accessible after they level up twice. Therefore, in order to reach Page 6 of the Bonus Rewards and gain access to their first Super Style, gamers will have to earn enough season XP to reach level 170 .

All Chapter 6 Season 3 Super Styles in Fortnite

Below, players can check out all of the Super Styles available in Chapter 6 Season 3 and information on ow many account levels they need to earn in Fortnite in order to unlock them:

Stormspark Super Styles
